content: First, thank you very much for your regular donations. You, and others like you, are what keeps Thunderbird available. If you will describe the problem you are having, someone here will try to assist. Please also share whether WIndows, Linux, or Mac. Thank you,
creator: davidsk

content: If you set up the account in IMAP on both devices, they will display the same messages in the same folders.
creator: davidsk

content: Unfortunately, the message list often uses a black font on a dark background. here the screenshot with a bold black font (unread) and here the one with a standard black font (read), where nearly anything is readable.
creator: h.it

content: In particular the unreadblack font on dark background makes it unreadable.
creator: h.it

content: here the screenshot for the issue.
creator: h.it

content:
re : I have enabled the Thunderbird dark mode.

I'm assuming you use Windows OS. What computer setting have you set up for apps ?

  • In Windows search type: Settings
  • Select 'Settings'
  • Select 'Personalisation'
  • Select 'Colours'

'Choose your colour'

  • click on the drop down and select 'Custom'

'Choose your default app mode'

  • Select 'Dark'

You should see an example at the top of that window and it should show 'Sample Text' using white font on dark background.

Where it says 'Choose your accent colour' Whatever colour you choose may get used for titles and buttons in Thunderbird depending upon some settings.

Confirm you have the 'dark' settings for apps.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
In Thunderbird

Click on the menu app icon (3 lines) select 'Addons & Themes' Select 'Themes' By default there will be 'System theme', 'Light' and 'Dark' You have selected 'Dark'

Have you installed another theme ? If yes, you need to remove any theme you have installed. It's not enough to be disabled. Please click on the 3 dot icon on the right side of the theme and select 'Remove' Then exit Thunderbird. Wait a few moments for background processes to complete and then restart Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hello there We have read the question We try to help

I could not get connected to the server. That error message appeared on that desktop or laptop screen.


The first thing to do is to create a new profile and to move the bookmarks that are there to the other profile ,then things are fixed and you are ok to use the new profile and remove the old one.

Also VPN use could block certain subjects. Try to turnt it off and see if it solve some of the issue here . Antivirus programs like Avast, Kaspersky ,BitDefender there use of them could behave aggressive to some other subjects like blocking traffic and is creating that error of you it can be.Methods of syncing with desktop and mobile devices the use of WiFi or cable usage ,the Firefox profile of that program is been corrupt of that ,try to get a new profile.

Greetings Firefox volunteer

content: Cardbook is developed and supported by a separate group, not Thunderbird. There is link to their support site and email address at this site: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/cardbook/
